page.title: 09THE PUMPING STATION
page.content: Addington Pumping station pumps water out of a well to Addington reservoir. It holds the water which comes out of our taps. In 1888 the old Pumping station began to pump water from a well 205 feet deep. It took 11 men to run it on three 8 hour shifts. It was run on two big steam engines so it had a tall chimney so it could let off steam. In 1937 there was a typhoid outbreak traced back to a worker at the Pumping station who was a typhoid carrier. The new Pumping station was opened in 1975 when the old one closed. The new one has a well 410 feet deep.Its equipment is fully automatic and it only needs one person on an 8 hour shift to run it. It can shut itself down if there is a fault. By Daniel Innes
